description: e- (prefix forming adjectives with the sense of lacking something) +‎ squamulose; squamulose is derived from New Latin squāmulōsus (“squamulose”), from Latin squamula (“small scales”) (diminutive of squāma (“scale of a fish or reptile; item shaped like a scale, flake”)) + -ōsus (suffix meaning ‘full of, prone to’). The English word is analysable as e- +‎ squamula +‎ -ose.

entries.meaning: (botany, mycology) Not covered in scales or scale-like objects; having a smooth skin or outer covering.
